title: Victoria the worst state to conduct business
description: A new report by the Business Council of Australia has ranked Victoria has the worst place to run a business, citing high taxes and excessive red tape. South Australia is considered the most business-friendly. #business #businesscouncil #victoria #southaustralia #news

title: Trump orders air traffic controllers back to work
description: US President Donald Trump has demanded air traffic controllers return to work as the ongoing government shutdown impacts flights across the country. #trump #flight #airtravel #governmentshutdown #uspol

title: Trump pardons Rudy Giuliani over 2020 election interference
description: Donald Trump has given several individuals who attempted to overturn the 2020 federal election, including former lawyer Rudy Giuliani, presidential pardons. #rudygiuliani #trump #election #uspol #uselection

title: At least 10 people killed in New Delhi explosion
description: Police are investigating after an explosion killed at least 10 people in India's capital New Delhi. #india #newdelhi #police #indiapolice #emergency

title: Former French President Nicolas Sarkozy released from prison
description: A French court has ordered former president Nicolas Sarkozy be released from prison, after just three weeks behind bars. #nicolassarkozy #france #francepolitics #prison #frenchpresident

title: Bali Three survivor refuses to give evidence
description: Sanar Ghanim, who survived being shot six times in a Bali attack linked to the Australian underworld, is refusing to give evidence in a Balinese court over fears for his own safety. #balithree #sanarghanim #underworld #bali #trial

title: Total fire ban issued for New South Wales
description: A total fire ban is in place across New South Wales as extreme heat is forecast across the state. #fire #fireban #totalfireban #nsw #fireseason

title: Mass reproduction event in Great Barrier Reef
description: The annual mass spawning event has occurred on the Great Barrier Reef, the biggest reproduction event in the world. #greatbarrierreef #reef #coral #coralspawning #queensland

title: Moment super typhoon shakes bridge in the Philippines
description: Dramatic footage has captured the moment a pedestrian bridge in Camaligan, Philippines was rattled by Super Typhoon Fung-Wong. The typhoon has slammed ashore in the northeastern coast of the Philippines, where the massive storm had already left at least two people dead and forced more than a million people to relocate from flood- and landslide-prone areas, officials say.  The biggest typhoon to threaten the Philippines in years, Fung-wong could cover two-thirds of the archipelago with its 1800km-wide rain and wind band, forecasters said. #typhoon #supertyphoon #wildweather #bridge #Philippines

title: Trump threatens to sue BBC over edited speech
description: US President Donald Trump has threatened legal action against the BBC over the way a speech he made was edited in a documentary aired by Britain's national broadcaster. BBC chairman Samir Shah on Monday apologised for the "error of judgement," which triggered the resignations of the BBC's top executive and its head of news. #BBCNews #news #DonaldTrump #sue #London

title: Foil-boarder punches shark after attack at Margaret River | 7NEWS
description: A 65-year-old foil-boarder at Margaret River in Western Australia had his board bitten by a shark during an evening ride. The man fell onto the shark and began punching it before paddling to shore uninjured with help from a friend. A shark warning has been issued for the area today. title: US shutdown drags on as controllers strike | 7NEWS
description: The longest-ever US government shutdown continues as air traffic controllers refuse to work without pay, causing over 2,000 flight cancellations daily. Seven Democrat senators and one independent broke ranks to vote with Republicans on a funding deal to end the deadlock, facing criticism from colleagues for abandoning demands for health insurance tax credits. Donald Trump has called striking air traffic controllers unpatriotic while promising $10,000 bonuses for those who continue working. title: Sarkozy freed as Trump pardons allies | 7NEWS
description: Former French President Nicolas Sarkozy has been released from prison after serving less than three weeks for criminal conspiracy related to financing his 2007 election campaign with Libyan funds. Donald Trump has issued pardons to allies including Rudy Giuliani for their roles in attempting to overturn the 2020 US election, though the pardons only apply to federal crimes while the individuals face state charges. The International Olympic Committee is expected to introduce a blanket ban on transgender women who have gone through male puberty from participating in female Olympic competitions by 2028. title: Australians fear clean energy transition costs | 7NEWS
description: Half of Australian voters fear the transition to clean energy will increase electricity prices, with only a third believing net zero will be achieved by 2050, according to SEC Newgate's Mood of the Nation report. The research also found most Australians expect the economy to worsen over the next few years, with neither Labor nor the Coalition seen as best equipped to manage the cost of living crisis. Additional topics discussed include the potential consequences of medically diagnosing children's conditions like Oppositional Defiance Disorder and a Norwegian study linking binge drinking in late teens and twenties to higher education and income levels later in life.
